title: Financial Mathematics Practical Competency Strengthening Program Using Situational Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational accounting principles, experience in financial statement analysis, and basic understanding of linear equations and statistics
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented training for industry professionals using real corporate cases, emphasizing mathematical tools (regression analysis, time-series forecasting) in financial data analysis.

learning_goals: Learners perform a step-by-step accounting system design process (budget allocation, cash flow analysis, risk modeling) using mathematical modeling and formula applications with real corporate financial data.

Learners propose adjustment plans for three ethical dilemma scenarios in a simulation environment using probabilistic analysis (decision trees, expected value calculations) and optimization techniques (linear programming) and receive a "suitable" rating from at least one of two evaluators.
Learners establish and apply innovative solutions using mathematical modeling (Monte Carlo simulation, sensitivity analysis) in emergency accounting situations (e.g., sudden regulatory changes).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
